akn:section.akn:heading: Age 62: regular commissioned officers in grades below general and flag officer grades; exceptions

akn:content.akn:p: (a) Unless retired or separated earlier, each regular commissioned officer of the Army, Navy, Air Force, Marine Corps, or Space Force (other than an officer covered by section 1252 of this title or a commissioned warrant officer) serving in a grade below brigadier general or rear admiral (lower half), in the case of an officer in the Navy, shall be retired or separated, as specified in subsection (e), on the first day of the month following the month in which the officer becomes 62 years of age.

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Deferred Retirement or Separation of Health Professions Officers.—
Deferred Retirement or Separation of Other Officers.—

akn:content.akn:p: (c) The Secretary of the military department concerned may, subject to subsection (d), defer the retirement or separation under subsection (a) of any officer other than a health professions officer described in subsection (b)(2) if the Secretary determines that such deferral is in the best interest of the military department concerned.
